ACT
40
MARRIAGE CONTRACT
A marriage contract can regulate property relations on existing or future property.
In relation to third parties, articles on the management or disposal of property have legal effect if they are entered in the land registers, i.e. in public registers where the entry is necessary for the acquisition of rights or the thing cannot be used without such entry.
The marriage contract is concluded in writing, and the signatures of the spouses must be certified by a notary public.
